poem:
**Under Siege**

In Jenin's shadowed breath,  
echoes of a wounded dawn—  
soldiers trace lines  
on an unyielding earth.  
Stone meets steel,  
the sky sighs.  
Through hospital walls,  
vulnerable whispers roam,  
amid the chorus  
of standing cries.  
History reweaves its thread,  
as the world holds,  
a tentative,  
unforgiving breath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel presses on with Jenin raid as Jordanian minister warns West Bank could ‘explode’ – as it happened 3.00pm GMT Summary of the day It is 5pm in Gaza City and Tel Aviv. You can read today’s full report on the Jenin siege in the occupied West Bank here: Related: Israeli forces surround Palestinian hospital and refugee camp in West Bank Here is a summary of the latest developments: Israeli forces have besieged a Palestinian". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
